text: Nice, thick, creamy, extremely bitter with strong piney, earthy and citrus notes. Moderate dark malts accents. If you are into heavy hopped beers that one is for you.
Ruikt heelijk door de hele keuken, flesje was helaas gevallen. Koffie en chocola. Smaak is lekker maar iets minder.
Dark brown. Thin head. Has a woody hop note, nice chocolate, actually comes off a bit thin, but you get the berryish hop fruit, too. Good but not super great.

Draught at Darbys Gastown, VancouverBlack color with Brown head. Strong earthy character, followed by the potent roastiness, and not as much hops as in other Black IPAs, although it ends with some hops resins. Too roasty in the final for my liking.Good, a bit too earthy (dirty) for the style.
Draft - Dark roast and some dark fruit with some piney hops. Jet brown with a decent beige head. Roast and some light herbal and pine hops.

On tap at Darbys. Pours a ln almost black with a dark beige head. Aroma is hoppy and roasted malt. Taste starts with toasted malt notes with piney hoppy bitterness after and roasted malt finish. Very nice and balanced black IPA.

Butelka 0,341l pite w domu. Czarne piwo, wspaniała mocna jasnobeżowa piana, piękne ślady na szkle..Aromat palonych słodów i bardzo ukryty kawy. W smaku gorzkie, orzechowe słodko-kwaśne choć gorycz zdecydowanie przeważa. Trochę owoców i ukryty alkohol, zbytnia gorycz obniża noty.

Black, nice head. Aroma: roasted sunflower, black malts, pine, subtle hoppy fruits. Medium body, sweetness and bitterness. Flavour: rather american stout, although there are some hoppy fruits. Long roasty finish, alcohol well hidden.
IPA style of beer are not my favorites. The black Ipa are much simpler and have more complexities. This beer will be head and wonder, is done with professionalism and craft. Good beer!

341 ml bottle shared. Appearance: A Clear dark red brown, with a average frothy off white head that leaves good lacing. Aroma: Quite malty, roasted malts, dark malts, chocolate, molasses, beries. grass and some citrus hops. 
Taste: beyond moderate sweet and bitter, leather, dark malt, roasted malts, molasses, chocolate,berries, grass and some citrus. Bitter finish which is mostly black, but with some good hops . medium body, soft carbonation, texture is slightly oily.

Bouteille 33. Bière presque noire à mousse beige abondante. Au premier nez : arômes de fruits jaunes, de pêche, de résine puis caramel, chocolat et (en retrait) café. En bouche le chocolat est très présent, explose. La rondeur + saveur + amertume dans un équilibre parfait en font une bière superbe que je vais certainement adopter : quel cocktail, quel régal !

Bottle 341ml. [ As Dunham Imperial Black IPA ].Clear dark red brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, dark malt, moderate to heavy hoppy, grass, fruity hops, leather, wood - earthy. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, leather, wood, dark malt, roasted, hoppy, medium dry. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20161018]

Bottle @ Johns. Pours black with creamy light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, fruity hops, citrus, grapefruit. Flavor is light and light bitter, light coffee, light licorice, fruity hops, citrus, grapefruit, light pine, light alcohol. Medium body, soft to average carbonation, lasting bitter fint with warming alcohol. 181016

Bottle, 8.6%. Very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, hops, grapefruit and earthy. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, earthy, grapefruit, pine, medium sweet and bitter.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Almost black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, hard roasted malt and moderate hoppy - grapefruit. Flavor is quite sweet and very bitter. Dry and very bitter finish with a little warming alcohol. Oily. 181016
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting, my place. Nice head with excellent duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich roast malt, chocolate, flowers, hops, pine and has a nice bitter finish.
Bottle 0.33l at home, Nivala. Colour is black with small brownish head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, citrus, some chocolate, some coffee, hops and roasted malts. Enjoyable.

Autant jai été particulièrement déçu par sa petite sur, autant cette offrande ma réellement impressionné. Malt grillé, chocolat noir, pamplemousse, amertume contrôlée (malgré les 118 IBU), alcool pour procurer une chaleur en gorge, vraiment une excellente bière de dégustation à mon goût.

Bottle ticked with Theis on the train. Black with a medium sized diminishing light brown head. Citrus, roasted malt, chocolate, wood, grain. Medium body, fine carbonation, mild sweet, assertive bitterness. Long dry hoppy finish. Good.

Botella, @Cata en el Dique 24/07/2016 BBD:08/01/2018
Color negro, espuma beige, sabor torrefacto, café, carbonatacion alta.

Pours pitch black with a small off-white head. Smells of chocolate and roast. Flavour is pretty much the same along with a fair dose of alcohol warmth. Very bitter finish. Overall its quite enjoyable

341ml bottle. Jet black colour with huge, firm, frothy, fairly lasting and lacing, beige to tan head. Intense, chocolately, roasty dark malty aroma, notes of dark chocolate, mocha, some liquorice, hints of molasses, a touch of toffee, bitter hoppy overtones, a touch of marmite. Taste is intensely bitter hoppy, roasty dark malty, notes of dark chocolate, coffee, freshly roasted coffee beans, a grassy hoppy touch, some marmite.

Tap at La Fine Mousse, 23rd June 16. Pours black, hazy. Aroma is complex, bitter grapefruit, cocoa, liquorice, pine resin. Taste is bitter citrus, pine, cocoa, smooth, burnt malts, liquorice. Really good BIPA
Bottle. Black. Malt, roast, citrus and licorice in the aroma. Malty sweetish roasty Peppery flavor. Hints of licorice. Very well carbonated. Citrus. Grassy hops. Dry finish.

Bottle at home. Aroma is coffee, big roasted malt, cocoa, fruity hops, pine resin, dark chocolate, grapefruit, notes of liquorice. Flavour is moderate sweet and medium bitter. Body is full. Very nice, potent bittersweet flavour with a roasty coffee resinous hoppy aroma. Tasty stuff!

0,33l fles van bierwinkel Alkmaar en gedeeld met lion. De geur is sateh saus en ketjap ook wat cacao. Smaak is bizar mooi vol met cacao en koffie ook de hopbitterheid met een trekkende afdronk. Real Nice

6oz pour at Eat Bar DC pours a murky black with some spitty, beige head. Nose is a mix of malt, bread crust, some rubber, toast, light coffee grounds, dried citrus rind, pine. Flavor follows, chewy grains and bread, pine, soap, dried citrus peel. Chewy, full bodied finish. Good, but I might like this even more if the abv was dialed back a bit.

Draft. Small beige head atop dark brown body. Aroma is moderately sweet, grapefruit, roast, some pine, cocoa, light smoke. Taste is moderately sweet, coffee, grapefruit/pine, some cocoa, light smoke. Medium body, some resin, stickiness.

Beer black with beige foam abundant and good retention. Malt aroma, roasted, resin, coffee and licorice. Entry into oily mouth with notes of dark malt, hops coffee and herbaceous. dry aftertaste. good body. Very rich.
On tap at BBF. Black colour with beige head. Roasted, hops, pine aroma. Roasted, coffee, hops, pine taste. Medium body.

Tap / Tirador.
@ Irreale, Madrid, España.
A: Black / Negro.
T/S: Hops, roasted malt, coffee, resinous, bitter / Lupulo, malta tostada, cafe, resinoso, amargo.

341ml bottle. Black pour, medium brown head. Aroma is very roast forward, but there are good amounts of resinous pine. Alot more cocoa notes than i expected, with subtle coffee. Lovely mouth feel, very lively carb. Finish is medium to high bitter, with alot of resins. The roast is bold, but is extremely well balanced.
Tasted from the tap on the 04/03/2016. Black color with smooth beige head. Aroma of coffee, fruity and hops. Taste is coffee, fruity, hoppy, dry bitter finish. Next one please!

341ml bottle. Black in colour with a large and lingering tan head, excellent lacing. The aroma is of roasted malt, dark chocolate, citrus hops, some espresso. The flavour is of citrus hops, chocolate malts, piney hops. Intensely bitter mouthfeel, medium body, high carbonation. Finishes long and quite bitter. These Black IPAs always catch me off guard but there is something about a hoppy porter that I really enjoy.

practically black colour, huge, dense brown head, which lasts for several minutes; aroma of roasted malts, coffee, milk chocolate, citruses, hints of ash, liqueur and resiny notes; taste of dark chocolate, heavy roasted coffee, citrusy notes and some resins; surprisingly creamy mouthfeel; excellent black IPA!

Bottled 341 ml thanks to Nisse666! Sampled on February 6, 2016 at crazy ticking evening with Thomas.Black color with a slight hint of brwon to the very bottom of the glass. Nice brown head. Malty, roasted, some chocolate, citrus scent. Malty, resin, bitter, chocolate (dark) taste. Chocolate, slight bitter aftertaste. Fizzy fairly high CO2 mouthfeel, medium high bitterness.

Bottle many thx to omhper cons 2016-02-06 Göteborg
AR: roasted malt, coffey, chocolate,
AP: dark brown, frothy cream brown head
F: fizzy, roasted malt, dry, coffey, dried tropical fruity, pine, heavy bitterness, wee dull
Bottle @ joes. Blacl colour with a fairly large off-white to beige head. Smells roasty, coffee, some chocolate. Tastes roasty, coffee, slightly iron, liquorice tar. Medium body, soft to medium carbo.

341 ml bottle. Bottled on 27.04.2015.
Pours very dark red, practically black color with a small off-white head. Nice roasty-coffee-hoppy thing going on on the aroma here, some dark chocolate and pine also, mild grapefruits. Quite creamy and fluffy palate, roasted bitter malts, slightly burnt, some espresso, faint licorice and pine-y hops. Quite well balanced, more like a black and tan than a BIPA, very Stout-y. Would love to have this more fresh but still excellent.
4516

341ml bottle from Firma-Bier
Bottled 27.4.2015 - Pours pitch black with a thick brown head. Aroma of roasty malts, piney hops, grass, citrus, herbal notes, hints of licorice and chocolate. Taste is roasty, grassy and piney with some hints of licorice, herbal notes, chocolate and coffee. Finish is roasty, earthy and bitter with some herbal grassy hoppiness and licorice. Okay, quite heavy for a black IPA, feels almost like a hoppy imperial stout.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere. Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: roasted malt, licorice, grassy hops and high alcohol finih. Taste: full body with roasted malt and caramel. Licorice and hoppy taste. Finish alcohol and roasted malt too strong. Not well balanced for a black IPA. Aftertaste: bitterness, alcohol.

Cela fait maintenant plusieurs années que je déguste cette bière dont je suis témoin dune évolution réfléchie et inspirante. Cette version précise minterpelle particulièrement. Dabord au niveau du look, la bière est aussi irréprochable quelle la toujours été. Un liquide parfaitement noir, une mousse beige onctueuse, crémeuse, dense et collante au verre. Le liquide dans le verre semble dune densité harmonieuse et savamment calculée. En faisant tournoyer le liquide dans mon verre, la pré-mousse se reforme instantanément et ne remonte que très lentement vers la mousse principale. Cette version-ci de la black IIPA me plaît particulièrement car les houblons, bien que bien frais et toujours aussi floraux, sont à mon goût personnel moins agressifs et mieux balancés que dans les versions précédentes de la même bière. Ceux-ci laissent ainsi une place importante aux malts dont la caramélisation apporte tonus, complexité et profondeur à ce liquide mi stout, mi IPA. Je suis exactement au point de jonction de deux styles parfaitement représentés. Texture soyeuse en bouche ou les houblons sexpriment encore une fois avec souplesse. Un paysage de campagne où jardins floraux et champs de céréales renaissent au printemps suite à la fonte des neiges. Longueur plus quagréable et jamais lassante, ce brassin de cette bière est pour moi un franc succès!

341 ml bottle shared by Werckmeister, thanks!
Black body, with a medium, dense, coffee-colored head.
Aroma of chocolate, orange, citrus, biscuit, some coffee, some pine.
Tastes of coffee, dark chocolate, citrus, orange, resin, some pine, cocoa, some liquorice, slight tobacco.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes roasty, bitter, zesty, a bit resinous, with cocoa, coffee, liquorice, some tobacco.

Very nice. I was expecting even a bit more, but still an enioyable BIPA, with all the typical elements of this style. Maybe not the most unique one, not among the best style examples Ive had.

341ml bottle at home shared with Saeglopur. According to the Importers Sticker bottled on 27.04.2015. black color, small dark coffee-colored head. smells coffee, licorice, a bit musty, creamy, cocoa powder, not too much noticeable anymore of the hops on the smell, a bit medical. still good smell though. full body, medium carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of licorice, coffee, bit citric, some ash, a bit pukeish, coffee grounds, toasted malts, some roast, a bit soapy, medical. finishes rather roasty with notes of coffee and licorice and a bit medical. good stuff, tastes a bit oldish / medical though, probably would have been better fresh, still quite drinkable though.

zwart met schuimige bruine kraag. aroma van karton, mout, chocolade, carmel, gebrande mout, geroosterde mout, laurier en drop. smaken zijn matig/redelijk zoet, redelijk bitter, licht zuur, sterk, matig fruitig, citrus, hoppig, geroosterde mout, redelijk kruidig van veel laurier, zoethout, koffie, mocca, caramel, droppig. chocolade, droog. redelijke body, glad en iets poederachtig van textuur, lage co2, lange bittere afdronk.

Bottle. Very dark brown - almost black, large and mostly lasting light brown head. Moderate to full malty and lightly sweetish aroma, roasted malt - faint burnt malt with faint - light fruitiness, piney - light grapefruit hoppyness. Body is medium to full, malty and dryish flavor, faint caramel, roasted - faint burnt malt, faint fruitiness, piney hoppyness. Finish is average to long, malty and dryish, roasted malt - light burnt malt, faint chocolate and lots of piney hoppyness - faint grapefruit hoppyness. Well hopped and roasted BIPA - nice head. Bitterness is not harsh.

(Dunham Imperial Black IPA) Bottle 341 ml at home, served into a teku, ABV 8.6%
Black coloured body, one full finger of dark beige head on top, thick and with very good retention.
Smells great, citrus, chocolate, roasted malts, coffee, all blending nicely together.
Taste is mildly bitter, with roasted malts and plenty of citrus, hops, ash, well hidden alcohol, coffee.
Medium thin body, good carbonation, very dry on the palate.
Very good!

Oct 2015 - Bottle share at the 42nd floor tasting, thanks to Kenny. 8.6%. Black, small foamy brown head. Aroma is plastic, light coffee. Body is medium, tingly carbonation, smooth. Taste is roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, leafy hops, dry finish. Very enjoyable black IPA.
Bottle. Aroma of passion fruit and roasted malt. Flavor has lots of tropical fruit, like passion fruit and citrus. Some coffee and licorice as well. Strong taste, like it. Good beer.

Bottle, pours black with a tan head. Grass, dark chocolate, spruce, tree bark, coffee, bitter orange peel, quite herbal. Light sweet, quite bitter, oily texture, average carbonation, lingering finish. Good stuff.

8th October 201542nd Floor Tasting. Almost opaque dark brown beer, small pale tan head. Airy palate, modest fine carbonation. Smooth dark malts, touch of mild cream. Mild hop skunk. Little dark fruits. Mellow pine. Light dry finish. Decent but its smaller brother is better.

Bottle at the sky high Canary wharf tasting. Many thanks to Kenny. Hazed caramel brown coloured pour with a lasting mid tan head. Coffee bean, black malt, and a little salt on the nose. Flavour is bitter black roast, coffee, and dark choc, pine hop. Palate is medium full, moderate carbonation, little sticky. Good black ipa

Bottle thanks to Mr Kenny. Consumed at the 42nd floor tasting. It pours opaque darkest brown with a thick tan head. The nose is toasty, earthy, charred wood, sticky orange, Irn Bru and burnt cake. The taste is smooth, yet bitter, toasty, charred wood, rocky road, umami character and citrus peel with a bitter finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Not bad at all.

Bottle @ home. Opaque black color, full sized beige head. Aroma is malts, lightly roast, grassy hops. Taste malts, roasted malts, nice hoppyness, grassy hops, pretty bitter, malt bitter and hop bitter nicely blended together. Medium body and carbonation. A fine Black IPA. Well done!

33cl bottle at the 42nd level tasting, London. Thanks to Ken for yet another CDA tick. It pours a black color with large beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, citrus, grapefruit, orange peel. Taste is roasty and bitter with orange and coffee. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, good

Bottle shared in London - thanks to Kenny. Pours mostly clear brown with a frothy beige head. Rich meaty dark malts, roast, cocoa, earth. Medium sweet flavor, lots of burnt cedar, baking cocoa, roast, scorched earth. Medium to full bodied with fine to average carbonation. Lightly warming finish, more cocoa, earth, light burnt pine resin. Not bad.
Black color with beige head. Aroma has lots of coffee, a bit fruity hops. Taste is coffee, fruity, hoppy, dry bitter finish. Oily mouthfeel. Very good!

Aroma of earth, olives and pine. The presence of roasted malt is overwhelming, to the point that the alcohol is quite mild despite its abv. Taste is bitter, bitter and bitter. Not much to it. Thick in texture with a long finish. Good beer I guess, I have no objections... but its pretty simple. Liquid roasted malt, thats what it is.
Donkere chocolade, bruine kleur met een volle bruine kraag. Ruikt hop, fruitig, chocolade, vanille. Smaakt hop, fruitig, chocolade, koffie.
34 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark brown with a little sediment and a light tan head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt, herbs, liquorice, and pine - with a roasted finish.

341ml bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, earthy and a hint of pine, Flavour is light sweet and medium bitter. Full bodied, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Finish is long, roasted and medium bitter. .

341 ml bottle. Thanks to Timo A!
Black color with a small tan head.
Roasted malt, milky sweetness, coffee, mild bitterness and chocolate in the aroma.
The flavor is hoppy bitterness, roasted malt, dark chocolate and ashy dryness.
Bitterness stays. Balanced and tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at MLF. Very nice smell, classic black ipa, cocoa, roasty, pine, little bit of peppery spiciness. Taste is very nice too. More subtle than the aroma. Light chocolate and roast to start then the finish is hoppy, pine and citrus but with the chocolate still bubbling under. Hides the strength well.

Negro opaco y epsuma beis uniforme y duradera. Aromas de chocolate, vainilla, tostados, pino y, más ligero, fruta naranja. Cuerpo medio- alto. Sabor inicial achocolatado que pronto deja paso a un intenso y vibrante gusto del pino y fnial de amargor tostado y resinoso.

Pith dense black color with sediments and a creamy brown head. Aroma has coffee, chocolate, pine needles and citrus, with a solid roasted malts backbone. Taste follows the aroma, very intense chocolate and coffee with strong pine and citrus characteristics. Really bitter aftertaste. Surely a solid DBIPA.

[7425-20150730] Tap. Light cola and plant aroma with a hint of friendly spices. Black body with a medium-lasting foamy tan head. Boozy bitter roasted grains flavour has a burnt wood background. Full body. Good. (8-/3/8/3/16) 3.8
(@ Volo, Toronto, ON)
Bottle. Rich aroma of roasted grains, cherry, and licorice. Great taste, well balanced roasty fruity and bitter. Very good.

Bottle from Le Marche des Brasseurs in Hull. Pitch black pour with minimal carbonation and little head. Aroma is coffee and dark roasted malts, dark chocolate, some pine hops. Taste is very bitter - coffee and roasted flavors more than hops, but there's some of that too. Rich palate but manages to stay light with the strong carbonation. Quite bitter but thought it would be way more so with 117 IBUs. Very solid example of a black IPA.

341 mL bottle. Jet black with a medium, light brown head. Awesome lacing. The aroma in very appealing - nice mix of roast and orange-y hops. Smells a little like those chocolate oranges. the flavour is not as big as the aroma would have you believe. Disappointing, but still, its appealing, Nice balance of the two worlds.

Huge rocky light brown, long lasting head with excellent lacing over a pitch black body.Heavy malty aroma of toasted grains, molasses, dark chocolate and black coffee with some grapefruit hops hiding in the mix. Excellent flavour of citrus followed by a bitter black chocolate, coffee, long lasting finish.Medium creamy body with lively carbonation and alcohol (8.6ABV) well hidden. Very nice indeed!

Arômes trés puissant de malt rôti, bois cendré, café moka mais aussi de houblons rappelant les agrumes comme la mandarine et pamplemousse. En bouche, le goût fruité prend le dessus rapidement. Cest frais et très doux considérant le taux dalcool. Les saveurs de torréfactions suivent rapidement et le tout sharmonise parfaitement. Lamertume sétire longuement en laissant sur les papilles des efluves de grains de café de noisettes et de pamplemousse. Sans la mention "impériale" sur la bouteille, on pourrait sy méprendre tellement le liquide est souple, frais et lalcool presque inexistante au goût et au nez.

Who the hell uses twist-off tops for 8.6% an IBIPA? Anyway... Black as the night, lovely build brew. Great hop aroma, both pine and earthy as well as more citrus flavours. Certianly malty though, with roast and some chocolate. The real highlight of this brew is the taste though, a real explosion and just up my alley! Roast, strong bitterness, heating up in the alcoholic ending. Punchy, even for the abv. Great mouth feel, not cloying at all, partly due to the active bubbly carbonation. Very yummy indeed. I am in love with this style, and this is one of the best Ive had. (Freshly traded with _Papou_, many thanks!)

117 IBUs mais cest très bien dosé. Ma black IPA préféré au Québec certainement, suivi par la black IPA régulière de dunham. Très houblonné pour une black IPA, on goûte bien le côté torréfié comme dans la régulière, mais encore plus les houblons qui donne un côté très floral à lexpérience. On sent bien lalcool. Délicieux.

Bottle from Halles St-Jean. Aroma: good balance between citrus/grapefruit aroma, coffee, chocolate and roast. App: pitch black with medium frothy beige head. Taste and palate: creamy full body, citrus/fruity taste then coffee and chocolate with heavy bitterness finish. Medium carbonation. Overall: wow! A refreshing black IPA. Definitely something that needs to be drank fresh to enjoy the balance between the fruits from the IPA and the roast from the stout.

Aroma is a deep earthiness with slight citrus and hay notes. Light carbonation. Taste is a sweet roastiness which is met by a fairly pronounced deep hop body. The bitterness does dissipate very smoothly. A very well balanced IPA overall. Appearance is black with a white creamy head that retains well.

I really enjoyed the Dunham Black IPA, so I picked up a sixer of the Imperial Black IPA on faith. Best. Purchase. Ever. Date on the package is Oct. 23, so this stuff is fresh as hell (and it shows).
Overall its basically a turbocharged version of the Black IPA: more malt profile, more hops, more booze. Nose is dark chocolate/cocoa, caramel, molasses with this amazing, fragrant grapefruit/pine/floral hop punch. Taste is a beautiful, heavy, chocolaty imperial stout hopped to the gills, with a big citrus/pine/floral hop finish. Its definitely bitter, but its so wonderfully balanced with the malt that the bitterness isnt overwhelming at all, nor is the malt. (The 8.6% alcohol is beyond unnoticed.) The review below that describes this as 90% dark chocolate with grapefruit is bang on. I think this just became my favourite beer on earth.

341ml bottle. Black pour with a thick frothy tan head. Flavors are toasted bread, roasted malts, chocolate, citrus and resinous hops with grassy and spicy notes. Generous bitterness. Full body, moderate carbonation, creamy texture.

Une bière dun noir sans équivoque se laisse dominer par une épaisse mousse moka laissant derrière elle une filée de dentelle sur les parois du verre. Imaginez des cocottes de houblons enduites dune sauce au chocolat au lait et vous obtenez sensiblement le bouquet de cette bière. Ces houblons résineux et collants tapissent le palais (et les lèvres) et sont en symbiose avec les malts torréfiés et chocolatés. La carbonatation est douce et la texture en bouche est assez crémeuse. La finale est très longue, une amertume en provenance des houblons et des céréales grillées étant en grande partie responsable.

Draft de café,beaucoup dagrumes,une touche herbacé,pain grillé.belle complexité.C,est très rond , belle onctuosité,cest très amère, cest comme bouffer du chocolat noire 90% aux pamplemousse jadore, super bonne!

From 341 ml bottle in tulip. This beer pours a black liquid with a huge frothy brown head. The nose is full of roasted malts and grassy hops. Some citrus and grapefruit hop notes and caramel aromas come through as well. The taste is first a light malty sweetness and grassy aromas. The huge resinous bitterness and the coffee notes then take over and stay for a long time. Excellent beer with lots of strong stout and IPA character!

[Bottle (341ml)] Pours a very dark brown with an average size lasting frothy beige head. Some lacing. Aroma of leafy hops, vanilla, nuts, toasted malt and chocolate. Flavour of toasted malt, chocolate, leafy hops, nuts, a hint of alcohol and a nice bitter finish. Medium bodied. A well done Black IPA.

Draught at Vices & Versa in Montreal. 
Pours pitch black with a small off-white head. Smells of chocolate and roast. Flavour is pretty much the same along with a fair dose of alcohol warmth. Very bitter finish. Overall its quite enjoyable. 
2014-05-31
This is amazing. How can something high in abv and heavily hopped be so smooth? Aromas and flavors of coffee, dark chocolate, and a smooth hoppy finish. Excellence in a glass.

Pours a dark brown, edging on black. Very thick off-white head. Aromas of citrus, strong pine, and caramel. Give that glass a swish and youll, pick up some pineapple. Tastes of chocolate mocha, coffee, and a hint of pine from the hops no doubt. Overall, it is a battle of chocolatey malts, and piney hops. Very enjoyable.

On tap at Barley Brothers, Winnipeg. Black pour with a nice brown head, good retention. Tried immediately after Dunham's regular black IPA. Somehow less hop character here, but some nice roasty cocoa notes come out. Full-bodied, slightly boozy and very creamy smooth. Some coffee and vanilla notes in the flavour. I quite liked this - tastes more like a hoppy imperial stout. Which I love.
On tap at Barley Brothers, Winnipeg. Very herbal aroma and quite bitter taste. Enjoyable.
Black body off white head and some lacing. Cereal lactose and grassy aroma some anise. Taste is very roasty bitter cocoa dark chocolate. Nice black IPA

A great brew! Pours out a completely dark black with a frothy slightly yellowish head that coats the glass in a fine layer of lacework. The nose is heavily hopped and citrus smelling with big boisterous pine resin aromas. Tons of roasty notes and espresso aromas also fill the nose. The mid palate has a solid roasted malt character with some dark chocolate and smoky espresso notes. The finish has big intense hop flavour with grapefruit, apricot and pineapple standing out amongst sticky pine resins. A good balance between roast and hop overall with a heavy astringent aftertaste.

341ml bottle pours almost black in color with a finger of light brown head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is citrus, pine and roasted grains with chocolate notes. Taste is a chocolate malty sweetness with a roasted grain and citrus and pine hop bitterness balanced quite nicely. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation leaving a pleasant sensation on the palate. Very well done and highly recommended.

Bière noire comme la nuit, totalement opaque avec quelques particules, effervescence impossible à observer, et surmontée dun col brun, mince mais très dense, et qui colle sur les parois du verre. Arômes à la fois maltés et houblonnés, malt torréfié, café, grains rôtis, pain grillé. Le houblon apporte un nez principalement floral et épicé, poivré, mais avec également des notes plus herbacées, végétales et terreuses. On peut également déceler certaines odeurs de fumée, ainsi quune touche de levure apportant des effluves de cuir. Le nez est adéquatement complexe, bien intense et bien agréable. En bouche, pétillement moyen sur la langue, excellente onctuosité au palais, le breuvage est rond et soyeux! Au goût, lentrée en bouche apporte une étonnante saveur de riche chocolat noir que le nez navait pas laissé présager. Beaucoup de malt torréfié en bouche donc, expresso, grains rôtis, pain (très) grillé, cacao Le houblon prend ensuite progressivement lavant-plan, celui-ci étant principalement floral mais également légèrement poivré et végétal, nous amenant à une finale à lamertume élevée et fort agréable. Haute intensité en bouche, belle complexité, très bonne intégration des différentes saveurs entre elles, excellent équilibre! Cette bière représente, sur ce dernier point, une grande amélioration sur la Dunham Black IPA de base, grâce à un maltage que je considère beaucoup plus adéquat. Excellent produit!

341ml bottle. Pours deep black, mocha coloured head that settles to a blanket. Aromas of ash, bittersweet chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, resiny hops with a slight minty touch, too. Initial taste bitter, bitter, bitter then bittersweet chocolatey & coffee-like, piney hops, a little sweetness from the malts then tries to balance things..a little. Medium bodied with an oily, slick feel, above average carbonation, leading to a bitter, long drying finish.

On tap at Le Projet, pours a nice black with a medium beige head that leaves great lacing. Aroma is piny and roasted, feeling overall really fresh. Taste is of course bitter but not harsh, medium-high and clean. Flavors are spicy, fresh and almost minty. Roasted malt is kept in check, plays a supporting role. Body was medium, carbonation once again too high. Another great beer by Dunham!

Un arôme quon veut sentir avant chaque gorgé. Ma meilleur description de larôme est: crème glacé au pépite de chocolat trempé dans lespresso. Lattaque est en douceur, comme une excellente stout, mais sans le côté "rentre dedans". La finale est longue et ramène le côté torrifié des arômes. Une bière facile à boire, malgré un style qui devrait faire peur aux néophytes, je leurs recommenderais.

Bière noire profonde; faible mousse moka; 
saveurs dexpresso, chocolat noir, malts grillé, houblon herbacé et pamplemousse; très légèrement fumé

Noire opaque avec un col de mousse de couleur moka. Nez chocolat noir, de café et de houblon. Goût très chocolat et de grillé avec une magnifique amertume qui se mélange aux autres saveurs pour donner un bel équilibre.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2014 Dun noir profond avec de léger reflet brun avec un col moyen beige! Nez complexe de café,chocolat,grains grillés et quelques fruits. En bouche café, malt grillés, petite touche de chocolat,quelques fruits sur une grande amertume. Une excellente black IPA qui aurait pu etre légèrement plus alcoolisé pour le style, mais encore une fois Dunham a la cote!
Une soupe riche chocolatée qui, soudainement asséchée par des houblons herbacés, se métamorphose en ipa étoffée et assez facile à boire.
Belle couleur noire. Effervescence mousseuse. Senteur légère danis et de ceréal grillés . Goute se quelle sent. Très bonne

Good. Very citrusy initial smell with lots of roast malt. Pours black with great mocha head and carpet lacing. Finishes bitter with a touch of sour. consistency is like thick citrusy fruit juice. A nice all around package, though the IPA and roasty malt dont entirely mesh well here. Bottle from Bieres du Monde.
bottle bought@ flaveurs dici. A: piny, chocolate app: pitch black lasting beige head t/p: med body with moderate long bitter finish. o: superb brilliantly brewed

Des petits bouts de caramel fondant flotte entre les habituels vapeurs de malt roti et de chocolat cafféiné. Alléché, on franchit le cap du verre, toutes lèvres dehors. Lattaque est acide, le malt rôti débarque dans la foulée, roulé dans lamertume caractéristique de lIPA. Le caramel s est barré, ou plutôt il a copulé avec le cacao et lespresso. Cest intense, franc du collier, droite et herbeuse comme une IPA mais joueuse et suave comme une imperial stout. Jolie expression, belle bière.

Aroma:rosted-choco malt mixed with pineapple juice..
Appearance:Dark good creamy brown head..
Flavor:grapefruit hops,resinus hops,rosted malt...

Black pour with a khaki head. Big aroma - big roast, chocolate and dank pine.. Roast, a bit of ash, dark chocolat and molasses give way to pine and grapefruit bitterness. Medium to full body. Bold to say the least.

Bottle Cloudy, deep, dark brown pour with a small, creamy, off-white head. The nose offers caramel, deeply roasted malts and resiny, piney hops. Medium to full-bodied with relaxed carbonation. Much like the aroma, the flavor provides caramel and burnt malts. Singed, bitter finish. Bottle courtesy of MartinT!

Not your conventional black ipa.  Deep deep roast.  Big roast wafting aroma. Big black colour with thick mocha foamy head and lace. Its hoppy for sure, but its also roasty.  Hence the imperial tital. Above average mouthfeel, with a bit of near-astringency at the end of the bottle. From Veux-tu.

Bottle: Poured a deep pitch-black color ale with a generous dark color head with good retention and some good lacing. Aroma of bitter citrusy and resinous hops is totally dominating with some dry roasted malt also discernable. Taste is also dominated by herbal citrusy hops with some resinous notes and some dry roasted malt. Body is full with somewhat of a creamy texture with good carbonation and no apparent alcohol. Usually not a style that I am very fond of but this one was quite enjoyable.

341 ml bottle from Broue Ha Ha, served cool in a tulip glass. 20DE12.
App.:  Deep brown-black with a nice deep mocha head.
  
Aroma:  Chocolate, coffee, dark-roasted malts, leafy, dank hops, slightly ashen, very deep and dark, like a big, stern Impy Stout with extra hops.
  
Palate:  Medium+ body, sparse effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Big dark chocolate and coffee, plenty of leafy, dank/pine hops, quite dry and stern, big stuff, nice and certainly not for amateurs!; dry with really big bitterness and a long-lasting, dark-roasted malt and dank/pine hops finish.

Black IPA are bewildering and highly variable.  Imperial BIPAs are almost twice as bewildering and variable!  I enjoyed this as a big, slow sipper.
Achetée au brouhaha à Gatineau. Belle couleur noire. Effervescence mousseuse. Senteur danis, clou de giroffe. Geuzasse. Picotement. Gout rend bien ce quils annonce. Très beau produit.

341mL bottle, sent from Glouglouburp (thanks Dany), pours jet black with a medium foamy light brown / tan head. Aroma is extremely roasty and harshly hoppy, with deep dark roasted malts, intense dry hops, and some burnt espresso notes. Flavour is extremely intense, with extremely darkly roasted malt, palate-scorching hops, and dry cocoa. Intensely hoppy and bitter, with a very dry palate. Robust flavour profile all around - nothing subtle here. The regular Dunham Black IPA is intense already (and excellent), and this Imperial version just amplifies it. It seems a first that this is on the border of being too harsh, but becomes more easily drinkable the more you have. This is most definitely excellent, but probably only for serious, extreme hopheads like myself.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2013 Another one of Dunham very good beer!  Coffee, chocolate, roasty. Great looking beer, very dark, and a nice long lasting dark caramel head.  117 IBU, very hoppy, and you can taste all of them!  A very good Imperial Black IPA, totally enjoyed it.
Bouteille 341 ml. Robe noire, léger collet brun-beige. Nez fortement houblonné, accompagné de malt rôti, de café et de chocolat. Goût semblable. Très forte amertume.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2013 Bouteille 341ml. Couleur noire opaque, mousse moka crémeuse laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme de houblon résineux, sapin baumier. Goût de malt torréfié, café, houblon, amertume en fin de bouche, résine en arrière-goût. Carbonation faible, corps moyen-dense, collante.

Bouteille de 341ml. Bière noire avec une mousse collante brune. Le nez est bien houblonné, 117 IBU ça parait. Il y a du chocolat et du rôti. La bouche est surprenante, très digeste, agréable et facile. Bonne amertume, bien équilibré par le malt. Les houblons sont résineux. Un succès.

Un goût franc de grains rôtis, presque cendré, samalgame avec le bouquet de houblon pour donner un résultat foutrement amer et délicieux. Lalcool (8%) ajoute du corps si on compare à la version «non-impériale» de la Black IPA  de Dunham.

Dunham a fait des différentes déclinaisons de IPA sa spécialité, et ça parait ici ; une IPA noire très costaude, épaisse et fortement houblonnée, tout en laissant de la place aux grains grillés. Elle chiffre à 117 IBU (sans surprise), et touche la cible à tous les paliers de lanalyse : odeurs franches de houblon et de café, chocolat et amertume tenace en bouche, finale tout en houblons et brûlé. Elle est totalement à la hauteur.
341mL bottle. Pours dark black.  Really hoppy.  More like an IPA than a stout.  Alcohol well hidden.  Much better than their regular Black IPA.

Pours black with a dark brown head.  Aroma is dark roasted malts and bitter chocolate.  Small cascade hop aroma.  Taste is mostly roasted malts and hop bitterness.  Missing the big hop flavouring but still a good beer.

Bottle - 341ml. Pours an opaque black body with a thin, lasting beige creamy head. Rich, complex malty/hoppy aroma with grainy, cocoa, and coffeish hints. Alcohol is well hidden. Its sharp hoppy taste carries roasty and woody notes. Ends with a robust, long, bitter/roasty finish. Very well done.

Elle est noire opaque, surmontée par une mousse couleur café au lait, capiteuse, qui se résorbe lentement en se collant au verre pour en laisser une franche écume. Belle odeur de houblon qui se situe dans la palette des conifères et dagrumes, entremêlées de fumet de torréfaction. Texture soyeuse, qui, tranquillement, nous imprègne la bouche dune amertume assez "rentre-dedans", mais en même temps, elle est amortie par le goût de café crème. Tout ça dure un certain temps en bouche. Lindice damertume semble démesuré, mais il est plutôt en panne. Comme si après une certaine mesure, ça stagnait. (482-071212)

341 ml bottle. Pours an opaque black (although somewhat sediment-filled) with a beige-brown head that lasted forever, almost until after I cleaned the glass (barely kidding, here). Smell is herbal hops, mocha, grapefruit. Taste is coffee and roast. Finish is tons upon tons of bitterness. Citrus, black coffee, coffee grains, herbal. I do not recollect ever having such a bitter black ale. Some warm, boozey feeling after the finish. Very strong body, creamy mouthfeel. Extremely solid black IPA, although may be somewhat unbalanced. Not for the uninitiated to the style.

Merci Martin! Après sêtre établi à partir de la fête de Noël avec un bon livre, je tire à sa fin avec ce breuvage agréable. Un nez léger de chocolat reste en place tant que le houblon se lever lentement. Fin denroulement intermigles laçage avec des lignes quaff. Le corps est singulièrement modéré et tarte générale. Terminer sestompe à partir du corps principal. Ma première impression asider de cette bière noire de lIPA est assez sombre. Cette bière nest pas sombre. Il, cher lecteur est bien équilibré et facilement consommable. Profitez si vous pouvez le trouver.

Bottle. Deep brown-black pour with floaties a nice creamy mocha head. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee and chocolate with light pine. Hops are more present in taste, but still more roasted malts and dark chocolate. Slightly rich and almost liquorous palate, medium carbonation. This is indeed another good beer from Dunham but I prefered their regular Black IPA. This one leans more toward a hoppy imperial stout than a Black IPA.

Dêgustée en fût au Vices-Versa. De couleur noire-brune et opaque. Nez de chocolat noir avec des traces de chocolat au lait, de malt rôti, de houblon herbeux, moyennement résineuses et aux notes citriques avec des traces de crème brûlée. Moyenne-ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture légèrement crémeuse. Faibles notes de crème brûlée accompagné dune moyenne amertume de houblon herbeux aux notes citriques (présent en arrière-goût toute la gorgée) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de malt assez rõti, un moyen goût de chocolat noir et des notes de pain grillé puis en finale lamertume de houblon est plus herbeuse, moyennement asséchante et résineuse. Post-goût long et plutôt sec, moyennement amer de rôti, de houblon herbeux aux notes résineuses et citriques avec des notes de chocolat. (25 mars 2012)

pours pitch black with a low beige head, some retention and lacing. deep roasted malts, some lightly burnt-smoky notes, lactose-like sweetness, bitter chocolate, tingling yet warming alcohol, big piney but mostly citrusy hops. average to soft carbonation, full body - maybe too much as per drinkability, medium long citrusy finish. relatively sweet and boozy but very good offering.

New tasting out of the recent bottles after a brief visit in February at the Winter Warmer. A tenacious, healthy dark tan foam of great endurance resides above the close to blackness. Tenebrous aroma packed with dark malt flavours, very roasty and particularly chocolatey. Were it not for the unforgiving hops, this would be a fine stout, which is rather rare among black IPAs. The chocolate notes are rich, cakey, filling, yet the hop wave eats it all, its resin-thrower drying out any hint of sweetness, leading to an almost astringent, very bitter finish that lasts on and on. Despite all the malts laudability and surprisingly full palate, this comes across as too brutal and unsubtle for my tastes. The hop profile does indeed showcase some complex green citrusy, earthy notes, but in the end, it all feels a bit purposeless besides for people with a desire for a drink who annihilates the potential for appreciating any other drink on a particular day. After having had a Leos early breakfast an hour ago, Im feeling a bit lost as to how the immense care for balance of the former is completely gone havoc with the latter. For impact beer fans only.

Pours a pitch black color with a thick brown head. Pleasant aroma of roasted malt, toasted bread and citrusy hops. The flavor is very strong, yet incredibly well balanced, the roasted malt, toasted bread and citrusy do their job in unison, its reasonably dry and theres a medium bitter finish. The body is medium with a slightly creamy texture and moderate carbonation. I expected something really good and I cant say Im disapointed, this is really good.

Bouteille 341 ml. 8%. Couleur noire comme la nuit, mousse brune épaisse. Arôme de café noir, chocolat, houblon frais. Très veloutée en bouche, notes de houblons, espresso, chocolat noir, malt, agrumes du houblon. Amertume très présence en finale.

Quelques verres à Dunham et quelques bouteilles depuis les derniers jours.  Une robe bien peu différente de sa petite sur.  Une tête mousseuse du tonnerre, dense et pleine de rétention.  Un nez chocolaté et rôti qui est rapidement bombardé par des conifères, des fleurs et des agrumes.  Sur les papilles, un caramel foncé et des chocolats fondants qui soffrent la folie des grandeurs houblonnées : des fleurs, de la résine, une forêt boréale et des notes citronnées comme un spectacle fort mais jamais exagéré.  Un alcool qui est dangereux puisque complètement caché.  En bouche, un corps superbement conditionné avec sa texture crémeuse et son pétillement délicat mais efficace.  Une finale bien prenante, robuste mais intelligente sur des notes amères de houblons et de malts rôtis et chocolatés.  Encore une fois, que du bonheur en provenance de ce petit village des Cantons-de-lEst.

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2012 Bottle (341 ml). Black with a huge creamy brown head and some lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, fruits, citrus, chocolate and pine. Taste is more of chocolate with roasted malt, pine and slight fruit/citrus. Medium bitterness. Medium body. Leaves a long lasting chocolate and bitter aftertaste. As good as their regular Black IPA... I really love what Dunham is doing with their line-up right now!

Bottle 341ml.
Pours black with medium brown head. Good lacing. Aroma is of roasted malt, chocolate, fruits, citrus. Taste is of roasted malt, chocolate, bitterness, citrus. Palate: medium body. Overall: Very good. On the roast side.

Cask at Vices et Versa, Montreal - 03/03/12.
Dark black with a decent beige head.
Floral hops on the nose, some herb/spice.
Hop forward in flavour with a roasted malt backbone with a little pepper/chocolate in the mix.
Medium bodied, little carbonation, well balanced with a moderate to dry finish.
Good stuff!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
In short: A delicious chocolaty maltiness and a dry super-bitter hopping.  Good even if a bit too harsh
How: Tap at Les Soeurs Grises, Montreal
The look: Black body topped by a medium tan head with medium retention
In long: Nose is intensely piney with also presence of chocolate, roast and citrus fruits.  Taste starts like a rich fluffy chocolate cake with no icing and light roasty notes.  Very pleasant chocolaty malt bill here, most imperial stouts only dream of a rich mouthful of chocolaty malts like this Black IPA.  But then comes the abrasive extremely sharp and bitter hops.  Very dry roasted uber-bitter finish.  I remember loving this beer in small samples at Hivernale Des Brasseurs 2012, but somehow when I had a full serving at Soeurs Grises I thought it was a bit too harsh, even for a hophead-black-ipa-lover like me.  Still pretty good but one glass was enough.  But this is only my opinion expressed in my own words, because I think it is doleful when people try to appear more erudite and apropos by using fancy words like doleful, erudite and apropos.

Sample from cask at Winter Warmer 2012.
Appearance : Black with creamy pale brown head.

Aroma : Great citrusy and floral hops. Oily and piny. Roasted malt with some coffee.

Taste : Great oily and resinous hops. Citrusy and piny. Nice roasted malt. Finish oily and juicy hops.

Palate : Nice cask conditioning, really soft and creamy.

Overall : Wow really good. Even better since the cask conditioning was exemplary. Great sharp hops all around well balanced with the roasted malt. Great finish. The regular black IPA is awesome and this one was also pretty good. Id need a full serving to make a fair rating.

Sample, 4 ounces, draught, at the Hivernale des brasseurs, savoured on February 25 2012; eye: black, opaque, nice creamy beige head, good lacing; nose: resinous hops, roasted malt, burnt malt; mouth: resinous hops, roasted malt, burnt malt, alcohol, dry finale in burnt malt with presence of roasted malt, full body, mild astringency, mildly bitter, lightly harsh texture; overall: fine FRANÇAIS Échantillon, 4 onces, en fût, bue à lHivernale des brasseurs, savourée le 25 février 2012; il : noire, opaque, belle mousse beige crémeuse, bonne dentelle; nez : houblon résineux, malt rôti, malt brûlé; bouche : houblon résineux, malt rôti, malt brûlé, alcool, finale sèche en malt brûlé avec présence de malt rôti, corsée, astringence moyenne, moyennement amère, texture légèrement rugueuse; en résumé : bien

Verre de dégustation, provenant dun fût, dégusté à lHivernale des Brasseurs 2012 (Montréal, QC). Arôme: Odeur de céréales grillées avec une pointe dagrumes. Apparence: La couleur est noire opaque. Présence dun mince col beige mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréales grillées avec une pointe dagrumes et de chocolat. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture minérale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût houblonné. (Rating #4151)

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2013 My Bottom Line:
Dark chocolate-covered almonds move into caramel and conifers in this beautifully expressive Imperial Black IPA.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam laces all around the blackness and its dark brown edges.
-The potent resinous hop bitterness is longlasting. It could have been softer to increase drinkability.
-I love the aromas and flavors that come from this grain bill.
-Almond skin angles are delightful.
-This can be as good as their Lapatt Robust Porter. World-class, in its category.

Bottle and on tap at Brouhaha, Vices et Versa and Hivernale des Brasseurs.

Drank at the 2012 Winter Warmer Montreal, on February 25. Black, small head. Hoppy aroma of coffee, green herbs notes. Roasted malt flavor, slightly bitter, alcohol very, very bitter. Not bad but its under the standard!

On tap & cask @ Winter Warmer 2012. Pitch black with a big moka head. Nose is moka coffee and citrussy hops. Big, full body, almost an impy stout mouthfeel with loads of chocolate, brownies, roasted cereals with a big bitter finish that lasts for a while. Really loved it.

A deep dark black IPA with a thin creamy and lacing very dark brown head. In aroma, a smooth bitter chocolate with resinous hops, grassy and smooth. In mouth, a smooth nutty chocolate malt with resinous hops, bitter throughout, oily mouthfeel, roasted coffee in finale. On tap at Vices et Versa, Feb. 10 2012.
